thread.title: Ideas For Partner Workouts
thread.title_full: Ideas For Partner Workouts | POPSUGAR Fitness

author: Rebecca Brown paid for by Kohl's
title: Ideas For Partner Workouts
text:
Get your start and head to a trail — hiking doesn't necessarily have to equate to huge intervals and rocky terrain. For a light workout, you and your beau can take a nice leisurely stroll for a few miles at a nearby preserve. Be sure to wear closed-toe shoes and tops that layer easily .
1 / 4 Head to the park for Frisbee What’s Your Reaction? Thanks for your reaction Don’t forget to share this with your friends! Image Source: Shutterstock If the two of you live in a more urban setting and it's too hard to find a spot to go hiking, Frisbee is another fun, entry-level activity. Make sure both of you put on apparel that's comfortable and lightweight , then head to your local park to start a game. With every flick of the Frisbee you'll work your core and torso, and it's up to you two how intensely you want to play.
2 / 4 Take a HIIT class together What’s Your Reaction? Thanks for your reaction Don’t forget to share this with your friends! Image Source: Kohl's A good high-intensity interval training class will leave you feeling toned and tired. Depending on where you go, you'll likely do moves that will wipe you out, like side-by-side burpees and bear crawls . Check in with your SO beforehand to make sure they feel ready for this kind of challenge.
3 / 4 Partner yoga What’s Your Reaction? Thanks for your reaction Don’t forget to share this with your friends! Image Source: Shutterstock Deepen your connection by signing up for partner yoga. You'll increase flexibility, strengthen your core, and work right alongside your partner — it doesn't get more intimate than that. Be sure to have the right sweat-wicking gear before class, or if you're interested in doing it at home, this 10-posture sequence is a great place to start.
